The House just passed the CROWN Act to end hair discrimination.

Eight times, presidents have asked Senate majorities of their same party to confirm an election-year nominee for an election-year vacancy. All were confirmed, except one with obvious ethical scandals. 

No other Senate has failed to confirm under the conditions we face now.

Myth: Senate GOP rule from 2016 means they should wait.

Fact: In 2016, GOP said that you’d have to go back to the 1880s to find the last time an opposite-party Senate had let a President fill an election-year vacancy.

In unified government, the history is completely different.

Myth: There’s not enough time to study a nominee.

Fact: Justice John Paul Stevens was confirmed 19 days after his nomination. Justice O’Connor, 33 days. Justice Ginsburg, 42 days.

McCONNELL: Sen. Schumer declared the 2018 midterms would be a referendum on Democrats’ handling of Justice Kavanaugh and Republicans’ handling of the Supreme Court. He got his wish — and the American people expanded our majority.

We are going to keep our word once again.

McCONNELL: The American people are about to witness an astonishing parade of misrepresentations about the past, misstatements about the present, and more threats against our institutions from the same people who have been saying for months that they want to pack the Court.
